newsitem.title: USA: TIG Holdings Q3 shr rises.
newsitem.headline: TIG Holdings Q3 shr rises.

text.p: (All data above 000s except per share numbers)

NOTE: 1996 Q3 includes realized after-tax net investment losses of $0.5 million, or $0.01 a share, compared with realized after-tax net investment gains of $0.2 million, or nil per share, in the 1995 third quarter.

Excluding the first quarter 1996 restructuring charge and net investment losses, income from operations for the first nine months of 1996 was $109.0 million, or $1.80 per common share, compared with $92.3 million, or $1.48 per common share, in the first nine months of 1995.

Results in the 1996 third quarter were adversely impacted by pre-tax catastrophe losses of $2.9 million, or $0.03 per common share on an after-tax basis, compared with 1995 third quarter pre-tax catastrophe losses of $4.2 million, or $0.04 per common share on an after-tax basis.
The 1996 Q3 combined ratio was 103 percent compared with 103.8. For the 1996 nine months, the combined ratio was 105.6 percent compared with 106.0 a year ago.

During the third quarter of 1996 the company repurchased 890,300 shares of its common stock at an average price of $28.21 as part of its ongoing stock repurchase program. To date, the company has repurchased 9.1 million shares of its common stock at an average price of $26.31, or 14.2 percent of the common shares outstanding at the time of the program's inception in 1994.
